page.title: 05TANGIER FARM- FIELD SYSTEMS
page.content: Pasture management begins in March after the early Spring weathering has broken up the soil.Before sowing, compound fertilisers are used at the rate of 2.5 cwt per acre, and also 35% nitrogen at the rate of 2cwt per acre. Weeding continues until silage is cut in May. During June, the hay is cut and more fertiliser applied for extended growth and Summer grazing. Maize is sown in late March once the soil has been prepared by ploughing, and the application of fertiliser and a pre-emergent weedkiller spray. Usually 45,000 seeds germinate from 47,000 sown. Harvesting takes place in September and it is used for silage and quick fattening before slaughter. During October, hedge-cutting is carried out along with any meadow reseeding. Straw is brought in for feed and bedding.
